item.description:
This is one in a series of presentations that Phillip Werner, a co-organizer with the random group, will be making this summer.

While you can use our site to coordinate with other randomites you MUST register for this event with REI by clicking here.

=====

Hiking Maine's 100 Mile Wilderness (educational series)

Time: 7:00 p.m. - 8:30 p.m.

Presenter: Philip Werner

REI Reading
279 Salem Street
(exit 40 off Route 128)
Reading, MA 01867

Phone: (781) 944-5103

Maine’s 100 Mile Wilderness is one of the most remote places to hike in New England. Backpacking through this area requires a great deal of self sufficiency because there are no paved or public road crossings along its100 mile length and it can be very difficult to contact emergency services if assistance is required. Most hikers cross it by following the Appalachian Trail, but it contains many mountains, lakes, rivers, and geological wonders that are worth side trips or visits in their own right. In this talk, Philip Werner will relate his experience hiking through the 100 Mile Wilderness and the torrential rain, water  crossings, mud, and bugs that he had to endure. In addition, he’ll show photos of the region and describe his gear, food preparation and route planning process.
item.name: Hiking Maine's 100 Mile Wilderness (educational series)
